title: 113_hr1995
content: The Act may be cited as the "Assisting Family Farmers through Insurance Reform Measures Act" or the "AFFIRM Act." Adjusted gross income and per person limitations on share of insurance premiums paid by corporation are addressed. Section 508(e)(1) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to include payment authority, adjusted gross income limitation, and per person limitation for premium payments. Additionally, a cap on the overall rate of return for crop insurance providers is introduced. SEC. 3 amends the Federal Crop Insurance Act to introduce a cap on the overall rate of return for crop insurance providers at 12 percent of retained premium for 2013 and subsequent years. SEC. 4 introduces a cap on reimbursements for administrative and operating expenses of crop insurance providers. Section 508(k)(4) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to include a cap on reimbursements for administrative and operating costs for the 2013 insurance year, not to exceed $900,000,000. The cap amount will be adjusted for inflation in subsequent years. SEC. 5 amends the Federal Crop Insurance Act to require reductions in the Corporation's obligations in renegotiated Standard Reinsurance Agreements. SEC. 6 focuses on disclosing crop insurance premium subsidies in the public interest. Section 502(c)(2) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to require the Secretary to disclose the names of individuals or entities receiving federally subsidized crop insurance policies annually. Premium subsidy amounts must also be made public. The amended Section 502(c)(2) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act now requires the disclosure of names of individuals or entities receiving federally subsidized crop insurance policies annually. This includes the amount of premium subsidy received and the Federal portion of indemnities paid in case of a loss. Additionally, underwriting gains earned by private insurance providers through the program must be reported, along with administrative and other payments made under this subtitle. The Secretary is prohibited from disclosing information related to individuals and entities covered by a catastrophic risk protection plan offered under section 508(b), including administrative and operating expenses, Federal indemnities and reinsurance, and other purposes.
